uses: Pain reliever and fever reducer. Used to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever.
dosageInstructions: Adults and children 12 years and over: Take 2 tablets every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 8 tablets in 24 hours unless directed by a doctor.
sideEffects: Rare side effects may include allergic reactions, skin rash, or liver damage with overdose.
warnings: Do not use with other acetaminophen-containing products
Consult doctor if pain persists for more than 10 days
May cause liver damage if taken in excess
contraindications: Do not use if allergic to acetaminophen or if you have severe liver disease.
drugInteractions: May interact with warfarin and other blood thinners. Consult healthcare provider.
storageInstructions: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture. Keep out of reach of children.

uses: Pain reliever, fever reducer, and anti-inflammatory. Used for headaches, muscle aches, arthritis, backache, toothaches, and menstrual cramps.
dosageInstructions: Adults and children 12 years and over: Take 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 6 tablets in 24 hours unless directed by a doctor.
sideEffects: May cause stomach upset, heartburn, dizziness, or allergic reactions. Serious side effects may include stomach bleeding or kidney problems.
warnings: Take with food or milk to reduce stomach upset
Do not use if you have a history of stomach ulcers
May increase risk of heart attack or stroke
Do not use during last 3 months of pregnancy
contraindications: Do not use if allergic to ibuprofen or other NSAIDs, or if you have severe kidney or liver disease.
drugInteractions: May interact with blood thinners, ACE inhibitors, diuretics, and lithium. Consult healthcare provider.
storageInstructions: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture. Keep out of reach of children.

uses: Pain reliever, fever reducer, anti-inflammatory, and blood thinner. Used for headaches, muscle pain, arthritis, and heart attack prevention.
dosageInstructions: Adults: Take 1-2 tablets every 4 hours as needed for pain. For heart protection, take 1 tablet daily as directed by doctor.
sideEffects: May cause stomach upset, heartburn, nausea, or allergic reactions. Serious side effects include stomach bleeding and Reye's syndrome in children.
warnings: Do not give to children under 16 years due to Reye's syndrome risk
Take with food to reduce stomach upset
Stop use and consult doctor if ringing in ears occurs
contraindications: Do not use if allergic to aspirin, have bleeding disorders, or stomach ulcers.
drugInteractions: May interact with blood thinners, diabetes medications, and other NSAIDs. Consult healthcare provider.
storageInstructions: Store at room temperature in a dry place. Keep out of reach of children.

uses: Antihistamine used for allergies, hay fever, common cold symptoms, and as a sleep aid.
dosageInstructions: Adults and children 12 years and over: Take 1-2 capsules every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 6 capsules in 24 hours.
sideEffects: May cause drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision, or constipation.
warnings: May cause drowsiness - avoid driving or operating machinery
Do not use with alcohol or other sedating medications
Consult doctor before use if you have glaucoma, enlarged prostate, or breathing problems
contraindications: Do not use if allergic to diphenhydramine or if you have severe asthma or COPD.
drugInteractions: May interact with sedatives, tranquilizers, and MAO inhibitors. Consult healthcare provider.
storageInstructions: Store at room temperature, away from light and moisture. Keep out of reach of children.
